It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spindly appearance with slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which attract specific pollinators such as bees and wasps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Spigelia amambaiensis is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
